Description: Tondo sherd of Attic black-figured pottery cup; interior: in tondo, black-figure decoration consisting of female figure (only part of garment remaining; with added white detailing) to right; uncertain object in front of her, perhaps shield, of Athena? Exterior glazed black.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Venit suggests that the female figure might be Athena but there are no distinguishing features to suggest that she is.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 92 no. 314 pl. 68)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 445, no. B734, pl. XXIX, pl. CCXX)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1573) (phase 3)
